etymology.description: 扌 (hand) + 包 (wrap) = hold in one’s hands -> embrace
etymology.interpretation: The character 抱(bào, "hold; embrace") combines 扌 (shǒu, "hand") with 包 (bāo, "wrap") to convey the action of holding or wrapping something in one's hands, indicating an embrace.

examples.chinese: 妈妈抱着宝宝(媽媽抱著寶寶)。
他经过多年的分别时(他經過多年的分別時)，激动地紧紧抱住朋友(激動地緊緊抱住朋友)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jīngguò duōnián de fēnbié shí, jīdòng de jǐn jǐn bào zhù péngyǒu.
examples.english: When he reunited with his friend after many years, he embraced him tightly in excitement.

examples.chinese: 哥哥温柔地抱着小猫(哥哥溫柔地抱著小貓)。
examples.pinyin: Gēgē wēnróu de bào zhe xiǎo māo.
examples.english: The older brother gently holds the kitten.
